intro: Chelidonium olidum, commonly known as the stinkcup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its yellow, cup-shaped flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant produces a milky latex that contains alkaloids, which can be toxic to animals and humans. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. Its name derives from the strong, unpleasant odor it emits, especially when crushed.
